page.title: 17FORTON CHURCH + HOUSING
page.content: KEYSTONE AT THE TOP OF THE ARCH. NOTABLE FEATURES INSIDE THE CHURCH ARE THE PISCINA, THE CHEST, THE TOMB OF SIR THOMAS SKRYMSHER, THE GEORGIAN FONT AND THE MEMORIALS TO THE BOUGHEYS. THE INTERIOR OF THE CHURCH IS DOMINATED BY THE GEORGIAN RESTRUCTURING OF THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE NAVE. {HOUSING IN THE AREA.} IN FORTON THE HOUSING VARIES CONSIDERABLY IN AGE, SIZE AND DESIGN. THE OLD VICTORIAN AQUALATE SCHOOL IS NOW AN IMPRESSIVE RESIDENCE, AS IS THE SCHOOL MASTERS HOUSE. THEY ARE BUILT IN RED BRICK A DISTINCTIVE VICTORIAN FEATURE, WITH THEIR MULLIONED WINDOWS. TO THE SOUTH OF THE A519 THERE IS SWAN FARM, FORTON HALL, FORTON LODGE AND THE PARISH HALL (NOW USED MAINLY BY A CHILDRENS PLAY GROUP )
